postBySlug.html:
Essential JS 2 for ASP.NET Core Razor Components

Essential JS 2 for ASP.NET Core Razor Components is a modern enterprise UI toolkit that has been the built from the ground up to be lightweight, responsive, modular and touch friendly. It also available in other frameworks such as JavaScript and Angular, React. This documentation is a common documentation site for both ASP.NET Core Razor Components for Essential JS 2.

How to best read this user guide

  • The best way to get started would be to read the “Getting Started” section of the documentation for the component that you would like to start using first. The “Getting Started” guide gives just enough information that you need to know before starting to write code. This is the only section that we recommend reading end-to-end before starting to write code, all other information can be referred as needed.

  • Now that you are familiar with the basics of using the component, the next step would be to start integrating the component into your application. A good starting point would be to refer to the code snippets in the online sample browser which contains hundreds of code samples, it is very likely that you will find a code sample that resembles your intended usage scenario.

  • Another valuable resource is the API reference which provides detailed information on the object hierarchy as well as the settings available on every object.

Getting Help

  • If you are still not able to find the information that you are looking for in the self-help resources mentioned above then please contact us by creating a support ticket in our support site or ask your query. with tag syncfusion-ej2.

previous.html:
Getting Started for ASP.NET Core Razor Dialog in Visual Studio 2019

The section explains step-by-step process to create a Dialog in ASP.NET Core Razor with building and publishing using Visual Studio 2019.

Setup the application

Follow the steps which is given in the Getting started page to setup the application and render the ASP.NET Core Razor controls.

Initialize the ASP.NET Core Razor Dialog control

Initialize the Essential JS 2 Dialog control in any view (.cshtml) page under in pages folder. For example, the Dialog control is added in the ~/Pages/Index.cshtml page.

The following code explains how to initialize a simple Dialog in ASP.NET Razor page.

@using System;
@using System.Collections.Generic;

<div class="col-lg-12 control-section" id="target">
    <Button id="normalbtn" class="e-btn" onclick="@onBtnClick">Open</Button>
    <EjsDialog id="dialog"  width="500px" showCloseIcon="true" Content="<p>In the Succinctly series, Syncfusion created a robust, free library of more than 130 technical e - books formatted for PDF, Kindle, and EPUB.<br> <br>The Succinctly series was born in 2012 out of a desire to provide concise technical e-books for software developers.Each title in the Succinctly series is written by a carefully chosen expert and provides essential content in about 100 pages.</p>" header="About SYNCFUSION succinctly series" ref="dialogObj">
    </EjsDialog>
</div>

<style>
    .e-footer-content a, .e-footer-content a:hover {
        color: #e3165b;
        text-decoration: none;
    }
</style>

@functions {
    EjsDialog dialogObj;
    private void onBtnClick()
    {
        this.dialogObj.Show();
    }

Render Dialog with buttons

Create button model object and set it to button property like below code to render a Dialog with buttons in ASP.NET Razor page.

@using System;
@using System.Collections.Generic;

<div class="col-lg-12 control-section" id="target">
    <Button id="normalbtn" class="e-btn" onclick="@onBtnClick">Open</Button>
    <EjsDialog id="dialog" target="#target" width="500px" Buttons="@dialogBtn" showCloseIcon="true" Content="<p>In the Succinctly series, Syncfusion created a robust, free library of more than 130 technical e - books formatted for PDF, Kindle, and EPUB.<br> <br>The Succinctly series was born in 2012 out of a desire to provide concise technical e-books for software developers.Each title in the Succinctly series is written by a carefully chosen expert and provides essential content in about 100 pages.</p>" header="About SYNCFUSION succinctly series" ref="dialogObj">
    <dialogbuttons>
        <dialogdialogbutton ButtonModel="@dialogBtn"></dialogdialogbutton>
    </dialogbuttons>
    </EjsDialog>
</div>

<style>
    .e-footer-content a, .e-footer-content a:hover {
        color: #e3165b;
        text-decoration: none;
    }
</style>

@functions {
    EjsDialog dialogObj;
    private void onBtnClick()
    {
        this.dialogObj.Show();
    }
    public class ButtonModel
    {
        public string content { get; set; }
        public bool isPrimary { get; set; }
    }
    public class ButtonObject
    {
        public ButtonModel buttonModel { get; set; }
    }
    public object dialogBtn = new ButtonModel { content="<a id='newTab' href='https://www.syncfusion.com/company/about-us' target='_blank'>Learn More</a>", isPrimary = true };
}

Run the application

After successful compilation of your application, simply press F5 to run the application.

Output be like the below.
